Detailed Description

A DistinctProvider is a filter provider and is used to access only distinct rows of a specified columnid of a child provider. See also: Provider, FilterProvider, DataItem, FilterRule.

Member Typedef Documentation

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

DistinctProvider::DistinctProvider (   ) 
 

If the default constructor is used, the parameters have to be provided by using the method Init.

DistinctProvider::DistinctProvider (  Provider *  provider,
INT  columnid = 0
) 
 

On construction the following parameters have to be specified: provider: The provider which should be filtered. columnid: Specify which columnid should be distinct.

DistinctProvider::~DistinctProvider (   )  [virtual]
 

Member Function Documentation

BOOLEAN DistinctProvider::CommitRow (  INT  row  )  [virtual]
 

Commit updates done in a row. If an update is done for the distinct columnid the update is commited to all undistinct rows.

Reimplemented from AbstractDelegationProvider.

BOOLEAN DistinctProvider::DeleteRow (  INT  row  )  [virtual]
 

Delete the specified row and all undistinct rows.

Reimplemented from AbstractDelegationProvider.

Reimplemented from FilterProvider.

BOOLEAN DistinctProvider::GetMappedRow (  INT &  mapped_row,
INT  row
)  [protected, virtual]
 

Reflects by default GetChildRow. If a derived provider class implements a multistage manipulation on the child-provider, the child row of the very first stage must be returned.

Reimplemented from AbstractDelegationProvider.

INT  columnid = 0
)

BOOLEAN DistinctProvider::SetDataItem (  const DataItem &  item,
INT  columnid
)  [virtual]
 

SetDataItem reflects SetDataItem of the child-provider. according to GetMappedRow. Returns FALSE if no child-provider was set.

Reimplemented from AbstractDelegationProvider.

Specify on which column rule has to be applied.

Reimplemented from FilterProvider.
